sourcesContent:
import React, { useState } from 'react'; import { Row, Col, Card, Form, Button, Alert, ProgressBar, Tab, Tabs, Table, Badge } from 'react-bootstrap'; function TrustedContactPortal() { const [uploadStatus, setUploadStatus] = useState('idle'); // idle, uploading, processing, success, error const [verificationResult, setVerificationResult] = useState(null); const [selectedFile, setSelectedFile] = useState(null); // Mock policy execution data const [policyExecutions] = useState([ { id: 1, platform: 'Gmail', accountId: 'john.doe@gmail.com', actionType: 'delete', status: 'completed', executedAt: '2024-01-07 11:00:00', response: 'Account deletion request submitted successfully', confidence: 0.95 }, { id: 2, platform: 'Facebook', accountId: 'facebook.com/johndoe', actionType: 'memorialize', status: 'in_progress', executedAt: '2024-01-07 11:05:00', response: 'Memorialization request sent, awaiting platform response', confidence: 0.88 }, { id: 3, platform: 'Chase Bank', accountId: '****1234', actionType: 'lock', status: 'pending', executedAt: null, response: 'Waiting for manual review due to high-value account', confidence: null } ]); const [verificationHistory] = useState([ { id: 1, fileName: 'death_certificate_john_doe.pdf', uploadedAt: '2024-01-07 10:30:00', status: 'verified', extractedName: 'John Doe', dateOfDeath: '2024-01-15', confidence: 0.95 } ]); const handleFileSelect = (e) => { const file = e.target.files[0]; setSelectedFile(file); setUploadStatus('idle'); setVerificationResult(null); }; const handleUpload = async (e) => { e.preventDefault(); if (!selectedFile) return; setUploadStatus('uploading'); // Simulate file upload and processing setTimeout(() => { setUploadStatus('processing'); // Simulate Azure AI Vision processing setTimeout(() => { setUploadStatus('success'); setVerificationResult({ extractedName: 'John Doe', dateOfDeath: '2024-01-15', certificateId: 'DC-2024-001234', confidence: 0.95, status: 'verified' }); }, 3000); }, 1000); }; const getStatusMessage = () => { switch (uploadStatus) { case 'uploading': return 'Uploading death certificate...'; case 'processing': return 'Azure AI Vision is processing the document...'; case 'success': return 'Death certificate verified successfully!'; case 'error': return 'Error processing death certificate. Please try again.'; default: return ''; } }; return (

Trusted Contact Portal

Verify death events and monitor the execution of digital legacy policies.

Upload Death Certificate
 Important: Only authorized trusted contacts can upload death certificates. Ensure you have proper authorization before proceeding.
Upload Death Certificate (PDF or Image) Supported formats: PDF, JPG, PNG. Maximum file size: 10MB. The document will be processed using Azure AI Vision for automatic verification. {selectedFile && ( Selected file: {selectedFile.name} ({(selectedFile.size / 1024 / 1024).toFixed(2)} MB) )} {uploadStatus !== 'idle' && (

{getStatusMessage()}

{(uploadStatus === 'uploading' || uploadStatus === 'processing') && ( )}
)}
{/* Verification History */}
Verification History

No previous verifications.

) : ( {verificationHistory.map((record) => ( ))}
File Name Upload Date Extracted Name Date of Death Status Confidence
{record.fileName} {record.uploadedAt} {record.extractedName} {record.dateOfDeath} {record.status} {(record.confidence * 100).toFixed(1)}%
)} {verificationResult && (
Verification Results
Extracted Name:
{verificationResult.extractedName}
Date of Death:
{verificationResult.dateOfDeath}
Certificate ID:
{verificationResult.certificateId}
Confidence Score:
{(verificationResult.confidence * 100).toFixed(1)}%
Status:
{verificationResult.status}
{verificationResult.status === 'verified' && ( Verification Complete!
Digital assets have been frozen and policies will be executed automatically. Monitor progress in the Policy Execution tab. )} )}
How It Works
  1. Upload: Submit death certificate document
  2. AI Processing: Azure AI Vision extracts key information
  3. Verification: System validates against user records
  4. Asset Freeze: Digital assets are immediately secured
  5. Policy Execution: AI interprets and executes user policies
Policy Execution Status
 Automated Execution: Azure OpenAI is interpreting user policies and generating platform-specific notifications. Monitor the progress below. {policyExecutions.map((execution) => ( ))}
Platform Account Action Status Executed At AI Confidence Response
{execution.platform} {execution.accountId} {execution.actionType} {execution.status.replace('_', ' ')} {execution.executedAt ? ( {execution.executedAt} ) : ( - )} {execution.confidence ? ( `${(execution.confidence * 100).toFixed(1)}%` ) : ( - )} {execution.response}
Legend:
  • Completed - Action successfully executed
  • In Progress - Notification sent, awaiting platform response
  • Pending - Waiting for manual review or additional documentation
  • Failed - Execution failed, manual intervention required

ðŸ¤–

Gmail Deletion Request Sent
2024-01-07 11:00:00 - Professional notification generated and delivered
ðŸ“±
Facebook Memorialization Request Sent
2024-01-07 11:05:00 - Awaiting platform response
); } export default TrustedContactPortal;
